abstract.text: Explore different ways to use SwiftData to delete persistent data.

metadata.title: Deleting persistent data from your app

inlineContent.text: Data-driven apps typically provide a way for a person to delete data, and this
sample is no exception. It shows three ways to remove data stored in a
SwiftData model container:
Swiping to delete
Deleting with confirmation
Deleting all
If you want to learn how to add and edit data using SwiftData, see
The sample app shows a list of animals. A person using the app can delete an
animal using a swipe gesture. For example, the following code adds the swipe-to-delete option to the

Deleting all items of a particular model type is less common in data driven
apps, but there may be times when having this option is helpful. For example,
the sample apps lets a person reload sample data that comes with the app.
Reloading the sample data deletes all animal categories and animals from
persistent storage.
To delete all items of a particular model type, use the
method
. For example, the
following code deletes all animal categories before reloading the sample data:
When deleting all animal categories, SwiftData also deletes all animals within
those categories. SwiftData knows to perform this cascading delete because the
relationship between
and

abstract.text: Write your model code declaratively to add managed persistence and efficient
model fetching.
Create a data entry form for collecting and changing data managed by SwiftData.

doc://com.apple.SwiftData/documentation/.title: Adding and editing persistent data in your app

abstract.text: Types you use to access model attributes and perform storage-related tasks in
a safe and isolated way.
Track all inserts, updates, and deletes that occur in a data store and process
them as a series of chronological transactions.

doc://com.apple.SwiftData/documentation/.title: Fetching and filtering time-based model changes

abstract.text: An object that manages an appâ€™s schema and model storage configuration.
Removes all persisted model data from the appâ€™s persistent storage.
An object that enables you to fetch, insert, and delete models, and save any
changes to disk.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the context should automatically save
any pending changes when certain events occur.
Removes the specified model from the persistent storage during the next save
operation.
Removes each model satisfying the given predicate from the persistent storage
during the next save operation.
Writes any pending inserts, changes, and deletes to the persistent storage.
Automatically record data change operations that people perform in your
SwiftUI app, and let them undo and redo those changes.

doc://com.apple.SwiftData/documentation/.title: Reverting data changes using the undo manager

abstract.text: Describes the rule to apply when deleting a model containing references to other models.
A rule that deletes any related models.
Add the required capabilities and define a compatible schema to enable
SwiftData to automatically sync your appâ€™s model data using iCloud.

abstract.text: Sets the deletion action for the dynamic view. You must delete the corresponding item within `action`, as it will be called after the row has already been removed from the [`List`](doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/List).
A structure that computes views on demand from an underlying collection of identified data.
Sets the model container in this view for storing the provided model type, creating a new container if necessary, and also sets a model context for that container in this viewâ€™s environment.
A collection of unique integer values that represent the indexes of elements in another collection.
